Retire
In Comfort SHOW ME HOW
Current Fund Values Monthly Contributions Increases in contributions Investment Return Inflation Rate Term to Retirement (N) Term After Retirement (n) Monthly Income required after retirement Required monthly income if you want to draw less than the maximum income to achieve some capital retention after..
Balance of investment capital funds already accumulated up to this point. Future monthly contributions (payments) to the investment at the end of each month. Annual increases in contributions up to retirement. Interest rate. (ROI) Return on investment. Effective annual rate. Example. A savings account offers interest of 7% pa compounded monthly. Annual effective = (1+7%/12)^12 â€“ 1 = 7.229% pa Annual increases after retirement to keep in tread with inflation. Term to retirement. (Pre-retirement accumulation phase) Term after retirement that a monthly withdrawal is required for. (Retirement drawdown phase). Usually life expectancy of surviving spouse.
Present value of capital accumulated at retirement Maximum sustainable monthly income provideds Maximum sustainable monthly income provideds Present value (inflation adjusted) of the projected future value at retirement after N + n years ..
Present value (inflation adjusted) of the projected future value at retirement after (N) years. Maximum monthly annuity/income that your accumulated funds can sustain after N years for n years, until the capital balance is depleted. This is Inflation adjusted) `Present value (inflation adjusted) of the remaining capital after (N+n) years. Present value (inflation adjusted) of the projected future value at retirement after (N) years.. Present value (inflation adjusted) of the remaining capital after N + n years..
